pageContext.claim: “I was very honored when, without my even knowing about it, statements were put out by General Kelly, by General Mattis -- highly respected people by everybody, including yourselves. And the book is a work of fiction.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump says he didn't know in advance that chief of staff John Kelly and Defense Secretary Jim Mattis had decided to release statements pushing back on Bob Woodward's book, "Fear." But Trump contradicted himself hours later the same day. He said Mattis offered to release a statement. "He said, ‘Not only is it not true; I'd like to write a statement.’ I said, ‘Thank you very much. That's very nice,’" Trump said.
